caption: A wonderful hidden architectural gem in Paris. If you are a fan of Le Corbusier‚Äôs work, I highly recommend visiting if you get the chance. A particularly good activity for a rainy day!  Very close to the metro station, allowing for easy access.  The guide given at reception explains the story of the building well, and the building itself is very interesting to explore.

Good example, however it was a bit Spartan, it may have been preferable to have some more period furniture inside to see how it was ‚Äòlived in‚Äô rather than the odd photo from the past. Felt a bit cold and empty. Still worth a visit.

If you are into art, architecture and also intrigued by Corbusier‚Äôs sense of design, this villa should definitely be on your list to visit in Paris. It‚Äôs located on a quiet lane in the 16th. And so calm so you can take your time and really sense the way Corbusier wanted to design and style this villa. I definitely recommend this.

Came here during my architectural study field trip and was mesmerized by the building. Obviously, since its such an important historical building, we had to deal with much regulations such as putting on plastic covers for our shoes so as not to dirty the venue but apart from this, its a real architect's playhouse.
My favorite place in paris where worths to go every season. When I went there, it was cozy, not so crowded. Wanted to learn more about Corbusier
beautiful modernist villa! a must-go spot for any architecture passionate people

Excellent to experience the atmosphere of the house and try some of the furniture pieces. Slightly hidden away down a street in the middle of the block - follow the street signs. Visited with a combined ticket with the nearby Le Corbusier apartment - would recommend .
Fantastic example of preserved Le Corbusier 's authentic architecture! üíõ ‚Ä¶
Cosy little real life house made by famous Corbuiser

This building is mostly amusing. It is interesting to see how convoluted medieval spaces (which I love) influenced this ‚Äúprophet‚Äù of modernity. I would have wondered what it was like, had I not visited. I can see how he influenced our modern ‚Äúarchitecture‚Äú.  The latter statement should not be taken as a compliment. Superfluous beauty no longer enters into calculations while building residential and public places. The Corbusier exhibit at the Pompidou did not improve my opinion of him.

Nice piece of Architecture,  even though not the best Corbu's building. Interesting bit probably I expected a little bit more in terms of how it is presented. There should be more furniture around, the interiors are a little bit poorer how they are presented.

I am a total architecture "geek", so this is not coming from an uneducated perspective. While other reviews indicate that the guided tour may be worth it,  I was completely disappointed in the whole thing. It's dreary, claustrophobic, and badly maintained with nothing apart from a brochure with B&W pictures to give a sense as to what it might have been like while inhabited. Not worth the time, expense or trouble.

We tried to visit the Maison la Roche with my husband and my one and a half year old todler son. Everything was very unpleasant. Arriving is difficult and badly signaled. The ticket selling when you arrive is unprofessional. But the worst of all was the discrimination we suffer for going with our son. We bought the tickets and we were ready to start the visit when a woman (who refused to provide her name or role) arrived. She told us that baby prams were prohibited. Our son had just fell asleep so we didn't want to wake him up. So, we decided to visit the house by turns. My husband was waiting in the hall, but this woman said that they had to wait out on the street where it was very cold, because the prams were prohibited in the whole building including the hall, where we already were. I wonder if this level of discrimination is the same when the visitor is a person in a wheelchair.
A beautiful early modern villa by Le Corbusier with original floors and built-in furnitures. This a truly mind-blowing experience for architecture buffs for only ‚Ç¨8 per person.
If you are into architecture, design, cant miss it
Interesting to see! Not so big, doesn‚Äôt take more than around a half hour to see the whole space.

One of Le Corbusier‚Äôs masterpieces that die under awful management. The price for students is 5‚Ç¨, however the woman at the entrance told me that I can pay by card only from 10‚Ç¨ (which is illegal thing to do). So bring cash and be ready to face rude french service, but architecture worth it! üôÇ ‚Ä¶
Really cool experience of entering a Le Corbusier house. It is better to go with someone that understand architecture as the tours are not frequent
I would recommend going to the studio first, which has a limited open time. Little explanation here. But the building is beautiful.
discover Le Corbusier's beginnings here.
Fascinating look at one of Le Corbusier‚Äôs home
If compared to villa savoy I prefer villa savoye. Anyway of course you find all the main characteristics by Le Corbusier. Pillars, full line of Windows, space segragated with a cathedral entrance.
Interesting building worthy of a visit from anyone interested in modernist architecture. Staff friendly and knowledgeable.
architecture iconic building by le corbusier. 1926
In my opinion,  better than villa Savoye.  An excellent architectural work,  by Le Corbusier.
You will have a different understanding of Le Corbusier, even if you are an architect and have studies him for some while. You will get to know the man, much better ...
Absolutely stunning house by Le Corbusier, at his best. It is worth it to visit
A must for modern architecture enthusiasts. A scheduled tour did not happen and without explanation. So French.

Left wanting more from this one. The house didn't feel alive to me. It didn't speak to me the way I thought it would. Maybe because it is a little worn out and it is mostly empty of objects that could help bring some life to it.
Good. But mr Corbusier has better works.
So glad I made the trip to see this place!
Great to visit if you like architecture.
Just gets better with each new visit.
Amazing piece of Le Corbusier history
Interesting details around LeCorbusier's process and vision
Nice villa, it is quite straightforward.
Wonderful space to visit!!! Students ‚Ç¨5!!
Cute apartment
